description: {"blocks":[{"key":"doslq","text":"This protocol describes the generation of stranded RNA-seq libraries from placenta total RNA. Since RNA quality can be an issue with total RNA isolated from placental tissue, it is advisable to enrich mRNA using a ribodepletion method rather than polyA selection.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9s9bo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eki5p","text":"Prior to ribodepletion, it is especially important to ensure that the input RNA is free of contaminating DNA. This protocol, therefore, begins with DNase treatment of samples, using Ambion's DNA-free DNase Treatment and Removal Reagents. Next, ribodepletion and library construction are performed using the KAPA RNA HyperPrep Kit with RiboErase (HMR). Libraries are indexed with KAPA Unique Dual-Indexed Adapters to enable multiplexed sequencing on an Illumina instrument.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":195,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

groups.title: Human BioMolecular Atlas Program (HuBMAP) Method Development Community

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"610pn","text":"To remove any possible contaminating DNA prior to ribodepletion, follow Ambion's protocol (Publication # 1906M, Revision E) for their DNA-free DNase Treatment and Removal Reagents.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":138,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"r0jf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a4h2s","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bt5sm","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"akir5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fg35o","text":"Quantitate DNase-treated total RNA using Qubit RNA Broad Range Assay.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"file","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"6CF98A40808D11ECB76C4DDD36FDF57D","height":0,"id":204136,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"application/pdf","original_name":"DNA-free™ Kit DNase Treatment and Removal Reagents User Guide.pdf","placeholder":"https://www.protocols.io/img/extensions/pdf.png","raw_source":"","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ghmi86jn.pdf","type":5,"width":0}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fub3p","text":"Follow instructions for routine DNase treatment.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6ooca","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":416}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"as1s8","text":"Tip: when transferring supernatant during the final step, be sure not to draw up any of the DNase Inactivation Reagent. Take off a volume that you are comfortable with. There is practically zero loss of RNA using this method, only what you leave behind. If you need to maximize your RNA yield you can always increase the starting volume by adding nuclease-free water, but be sure that the RNA will still be at least   for library construction in the next step.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cq8le","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"60tcu","text":"Tip: The DNase Inactivation Reagent settles very quickly, so it is important to follow the instruction to resuspend it immediately before use, and several times during incubation with the reaction mix.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"concentration":"100","error":false,"error_concentration":false,"guid":"F1896EF0808E11ECB76C4DDD36FDF57D","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1854},"mutability":"","type":"concentration"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3kcnr","text":"Follow KAPA's protocol (KR1351 - v4.21) for their KAPA RNA HyperPrep Kit with RiboErase (HMR). In our hands, this protocol yields great results with partially degraded total RNA samples from placenta, some with RIN scores as low as 2.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a393s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ah3m6","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7i29g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"35l4d","text":"For HuBMAP samples, the following parameters were used:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aml1r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"akmg7","text":"Input total RNA:  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":17,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ecqbc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"mju5","text":"Fragmentation: tailored to RIN score (RIN score 6.0 and above,   ; RIN score 5.0-5.9,   ; RIN score 4.9 and below,   )","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":63,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":64,"length":1},{"key":4,"offset":86,"length":1},{"key":5,"offset":87,"length":1},{"key":6,"offset":115,"length":1},{"key":7,"offset":116,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6l7kc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5tom6","text":"Library amplification: 8 cycles","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"61c6t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6fajg","text":"For indexing, and to enable efficient multiplexed sequencing, use the KAPA Unique Dual-Indexed Adapter Kit , and dilute adapters to  . Using UDIs reduces \"index hopping\" which can be an issue when using combinatorial dual indexes, especially on patterned flow cells like the NovaSeq.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":8,"offset":132,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dg23p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bs6lo","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":9,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b6fum","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":10,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ffdr7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3rkib","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":11,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a00ac","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"file","mutability":"","data":{"forceSelection":true,"guid":"A74CD160809311ECB76C4DDD36FDF57D","id":204140,"original_name":"KAPA RNA HyperPrep Kit with RiboErase (HMR) KR1351 - v4.21.pdf","placeholder":"","raw_source":"","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ghmn86jn.pdf"}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"1000","error":false,"guid":"56FFCD50809511ECB76C4DDD36FDF57D","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":8}},"10":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":312},{"key":1,"length":1,"offset":317}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"42tdf","text":"Be extremely careful when pipetting out of the adapter plate - you do not want to cross-contaminate wells. Make sure to centrifuge the adapter plate before carefully peeling off the foil cover. Promptly replace with a fresh foil cover when done. Use provided KAPA Adapter Dilution Buffer to dilute adapters from   to  . {"blocks":[{"key":"cgfb1","text":"Quantitate libraries using the Qubit DNA High Sensitivity Assay, and check library distribution by running the DNA High Sensitivity Assay on an Agilent Bioanalyzer. A typical trace is shown below. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"63e9f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"591f1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6mbo7","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b1qs3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"result","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":0}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ebkr0","text":"  ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"a62sk","text":"Pay attention to the presence of any adapter dimers, which will appear at ~120bp. These will cluster on the flow cell and reduce the number of reads obtained in a sequencing run. If adapter dimers are present, perform another 1x bead-based cleanup using KAPA Pure Beads.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"guid":"52416140809D11ECB76C4DDD36FDF57D","height":249,"id":204157,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3gnt","text":"Note the appearance of several primer dimer peaks at ~40-60bp which are present due to a combination of the high concentration of primers in the 10x Library Amplification Primer Mix, and the low number of amplification cycles performed (low number of PCR cycles is preferable to reduce amplification bias). These primer dimers are not an issue since they cannot cluster on the flow cell.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":"step-B4E49180809A11ECB76C4DDD36FDF57D-nested-draft-6mbo7","original_name":"Screen Shot 2022-01-28 at 4.38.25 PM.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ghm986jn.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ghm786jn.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ghm886jn.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ghm686jn.webp","width":550},"mutability":"","type":"image"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2qh0v","text":"If multiplexing samples, first perform a balancing run to ensure equal representation of all samples in the pool. For the balancing run, prepare an \"equal volume\" pool by combining   each library together. Run the pool on a MiSeq instrument using a MiSeq Reagent Kit Nano. Based on the proportion of reads assigned to each index during the Nano run, prepare a balanced pool that will yield an equal read depth for all samples in the pool.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":181,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4m7vl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"2","error":false,"guid":"C05BC2F0809E11ECB76C4DDD36FDF57D","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dqlmt","text":"Prior to submitting for sequencing, quantitate the pool using the Qubit High Sensitivity DNA assay. Determine the average fragment size for each library from the Bioanalyzer traces.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"el3vq","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bqndf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6cma2","text":"Determine the average fragment size in the balanced pool, and use the following formula to determine the nM concentration:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3dsf4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7arqb","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"anshq","text":"Submit the pool to your sequencing facility, noting the nM concentration.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5hsqo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ssqn","text":"For HuBMAP bulk RNA-seq samples, the multiplexed pool was sequenced on a NovaSeq 6000 S4 lane using a 100bp paired-end run configuration.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3cko9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"52tfr","text":"Tip: set a region from 200bp to 1000bp in the region table tab (fragments over ~1kb don't cluster efficiently on the flow cell) and the Agilent software will calculate the average fragment size.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"1A9CA1E080A311ECB76C4DDD36FDF57D","height":112,"id":204161,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/jpeg","original_name":"image.jpeg","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ghnd86jn.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ghnb86jn.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ghnc86jn.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ghna86jn.webp","width":527}}}}
